column2: N-TVA; Braf Ca/+; Pten f/f; Ink f/f
Nestin-TVA; Braf het; Pten f/f; Ink f/f

The mouse appeared to have been dead for 24 to 36 hours prior to necropsy. The quality of the brain was compromised but fixed in formalin in the hopes of it being able to be used. Additionally, the skull was also saved due to growths found on it.
